page.title: 17NETHERBRIDGE
page.content: The original bridge,pre 1504,which is no longer in evidence, except as a ford, was replaced by {New Bridge}for which funds were raised by Bshp.Oldham in 1504.New Bridge is South of the junction between the Tamar & the Ottery and has been known as{Higher {New Bridge}when compared with the New Bridge over the Tamar at Gunnislake. The name{Netherbridge}possibly re- placed {H.N.Bridge}when Netherbridge Farm was rebuilt.Plans for the present bridge were proposed in 1925,but lack of money and subsequent war prevented work and plans were shelved until now. There are twenty men on site,employed for a contract period of thirty five weeks. They expect to finish work on the bridge after a period of twenty five weeks and the estimated cost is in the region of Â£500,000.
